tweet: @markvipond @BBCPolitics Nobody except the poor Remainers feared Brexit. The rest of us in Europe have  looked on in sadness and surprise, watching a country self harm but we certainly didn’t care half as much as you think. It’s your lonely mess to deal with not ours. Good luck with that

Verhofstadt is right that Brexit was an EU failure. But it’s bonkers to think it happened because the EU wasn’t enough of a superstate. It was because the Common Market the UK joined, which didn’t much compromise its sovereignty (aside from on trade) became the EU, which did.
